\hypertarget{operating-agreement}{%
\section{OPERATING AGREEMENT}\label{operating-agreement}}

\hypertarget{of-blauweiss-edv-llc}{%
\subsection{of BLAUWEISS-EDV LLC}\label{of-blauweiss-edv-llc}}

\hypertarget{a-texas-limited-liability-company}{%
\subsubsection{A Texas Limited Liability
Company}\label{a-texas-limited-liability-company}}

\begin{center}\rule{0.5\linewidth}{0.5pt}\end{center}

This Operating Agreement (the ``\textbf{Agreement}'') is entered into as
of \_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_, 2025 (the ``\textbf{Effective
Date}''), by and among the Members identified herein.

\textbf{WHEREAS}, Blauweiss-EDV LLC (the ``\textbf{Company}'') was
formed as a Texas Limited Liability Company on November 6, 2025,
pursuant to the filing of a Certificate of Formation with the Texas
Secretary of State (File Number 806293404); and

\textbf{WHEREAS}, the Members desire to set forth the terms and
conditions governing the operation of the Company and the rights and
obligations of the Members;

\textbf{NOW, THEREFORE}, in consideration of the mutual covenants and
agreements herein contained, the Members agree as follows:

\begin{center}\rule{0.5\linewidth}{0.5pt}\end{center}

\hypertarget{article-i-organization}{%
\subsection{ARTICLE I -- ORGANIZATION}\label{article-i-organization}}

\hypertarget{section-1.1-name}{%
\subsubsection{Section 1.1 -- Name}\label{section-1.1-name}}

The name of the Company is Blauweiss-EDV LLC.

\hypertarget{section-1.2-principal-place-of-business}{%
\subsubsection{Section 1.2 -- Principal Place of
Business}\label{section-1.2-principal-place-of-business}}

The principal place of business of the Company shall be at such location
as may be determined by the Members from time to time. The initial
registered office is as stated in the Certificate of Formation.

\hypertarget{section-1.3-purpose}{%
\subsubsection{Section 1.3 -- Purpose}\label{section-1.3-purpose}}

The purpose of the Company is to engage in the business of providing
information technology services, including but not limited to software
development, cloud architecture, DevOps consulting, artificial
intelligence solutions, and any other lawful business activities as
determined by the Members.

\hypertarget{section-1.4-term}{%
\subsubsection{Section 1.4 -- Term}\label{section-1.4-term}}

The Company shall have perpetual existence unless dissolved in
accordance with this Agreement or applicable law.

\begin{center}\rule{0.5\linewidth}{0.5pt}\end{center}

\hypertarget{article-ii-members-and-membership-interests}{%
\subsection{ARTICLE II -- MEMBERS AND MEMBERSHIP
INTERESTS}\label{article-ii-members-and-membership-interests}}

\hypertarget{section-2.1-initial-members}{%
\subsubsection{Section 2.1 -- Initial
Members}\label{section-2.1-initial-members}}

The initial Members of the Company and their respective Membership
Interests are as follows:

\begin{quote}
\textbf{Michael Clement Matejka} -- 50\% Membership Interest\\
106 Stratford St, Houston, TX 77006, USA\\
US Citizen
\end{quote}

\begin{quote}
\textbf{Ian Bennett Matejka} -- 50\% Membership Interest\\
Houston, Texas, USA\\
US Citizen
\end{quote}

\hypertarget{section-2.2-admission-of-additional-members}{%
\subsubsection{Section 2.2 -- Admission of Additional
Members}\label{section-2.2-admission-of-additional-members}}

Additional Members may be admitted to the Company upon the unanimous
written consent of all existing Members and the execution of an
amendment to this Agreement reflecting the admission of such new Member
and the adjustment of Membership Interests.

\begin{center}\rule{0.5\linewidth}{0.5pt}\end{center}

\hypertarget{article-iii-membership-option}{%
\subsection{ARTICLE III -- MEMBERSHIP
OPTION}\label{article-iii-membership-option}}

\hypertarget{section-3.1-grant-of-option}{%
\subsubsection{Section 3.1 -- Grant of
Option}\label{section-3.1-grant-of-option}}

The Members hereby grant to \textbf{Wolfram Laube}
(``\textbf{Optionee}''), an Austrian citizen residing at Unterer
Stadtplatz 18, 4780 Sch√§rding, Austria, an option (the
``\textbf{Membership Option}'') to acquire a Membership Interest in the
Company, subject to the terms and conditions set forth in this Article
III.

\hypertarget{section-3.2-exercise-conditions}{%
\subsubsection{Section 3.2 -- Exercise
Conditions}\label{section-3.2-exercise-conditions}}

The Membership Option may only be exercised upon the satisfaction of the
following condition: The conclusion of the insolvency proceedings
(Konkursverfahren GZ 17 S 35/25 s) currently pending against the
Optionee at the Regional Court Ried im Innkreis, Austria, by way of
final and binding court order or decree confirming the termination or
discharge of such proceedings.

\hypertarget{section-3.3-exercise-procedure}{%
\subsubsection{Section 3.3 -- Exercise
Procedure}\label{section-3.3-exercise-procedure}}

Upon satisfaction of the Exercise Condition, the Optionee may exercise
the Membership Option by delivering written notice to all Members,
accompanied by documentation evidencing the conclusion of the insolvency
proceedings. Upon valid exercise, the Optionee shall be admitted as a
Member, and the Membership Interests shall be adjusted such that each of
the three Members holds a 33.33\% Membership Interest (or such other
allocation as unanimously agreed by all parties).

\hypertarget{section-3.4-exercise-price}{%
\subsubsection{Section 3.4 -- Exercise
Price}\label{section-3.4-exercise-price}}

The exercise price for the Membership Option shall be One Dollar
(\$1.00), representing consideration for the Optionee's contributions to
the Company as an Independent Contractor and in recognition of the
Optionee's role in establishing the Company's business relationships and
technical capabilities.

\hypertarget{section-3.5-option-period}{%
\subsubsection{Section 3.5 -- Option
Period}\label{section-3.5-option-period}}

The Membership Option shall remain exercisable for a period of two (2)
years following the satisfaction of the Exercise Condition. If not
exercised within such period, the Membership Option shall expire.

\hypertarget{section-3.6-contractor-relationship}{%
\subsubsection{Section 3.6 -- Contractor
Relationship}\label{section-3.6-contractor-relationship}}

Pending exercise of the Membership Option, the Optionee shall provide
services to the Company as an Independent Contractor pursuant to a
separate Independent Contractor Agreement. Such contractor relationship
shall not create any membership rights or obligations prior to valid
exercise of the Membership Option.

\begin{center}\rule{0.5\linewidth}{0.5pt}\end{center}

\hypertarget{article-iv-management}{%
\subsection{ARTICLE IV -- MANAGEMENT}\label{article-iv-management}}

\hypertarget{section-4.1-member-managed-company}{%
\subsubsection{Section 4.1 -- Member-Managed
Company}\label{section-4.1-member-managed-company}}

The Company shall be managed by its Members. Each Member shall have the
authority to bind the Company in the ordinary course of business.

\hypertarget{section-4.2-voting}{%
\subsubsection{Section 4.2 -- Voting}\label{section-4.2-voting}}

Except as otherwise provided in this Agreement, decisions requiring
Member approval shall be made by a majority vote of the Members based on
their Membership Interests. The following matters require unanimous
consent of all Members:

\begin{enumerate}
\def\labelenumi{(\alph{enumi})}
\tightlist
\item
  Admission of new Members\\
\item
  Amendment of this Agreement\\
\item
  Dissolution of the Company\\
\item
  Sale of all or substantially all Company assets\\
\item
  Any transaction involving a conflict of interest
\end{enumerate}

\begin{center}\rule{0.5\linewidth}{0.5pt}\end{center}

\hypertarget{article-v-capital-contributions-and-distributions}{%
\subsection{ARTICLE V -- CAPITAL CONTRIBUTIONS AND
DISTRIBUTIONS}\label{article-v-capital-contributions-and-distributions}}

\hypertarget{section-5.1-initial-capital-contributions}{%
\subsubsection{Section 5.1 -- Initial Capital
Contributions}\label{section-5.1-initial-capital-contributions}}

The initial capital contribution of each Member is as follows:

\begin{quote}
Michael Clement Matejka: \$500.00\\
Ian Bennett Matejka: \$500.00
\end{quote}

\hypertarget{section-5.2-distributions}{%
\subsubsection{Section 5.2 --
Distributions}\label{section-5.2-distributions}}

Distributions of available cash shall be made at such times and in such
amounts as determined by the Members, in proportion to their respective
Membership Interests, unless otherwise unanimously agreed.

\hypertarget{section-5.3-retained-earnings}{%
\subsubsection{Section 5.3 -- Retained
Earnings}\label{section-5.3-retained-earnings}}

The Members may elect to retain earnings within the Company for working
capital, investment, or other business purposes. Such retained earnings
shall be allocated to the Members' capital accounts in proportion to
their Membership Interests.

\begin{center}\rule{0.5\linewidth}{0.5pt}\end{center}

\hypertarget{article-vi-future-membership-expansion}{%
\subsection{ARTICLE VI -- FUTURE MEMBERSHIP
EXPANSION}\label{article-vi-future-membership-expansion}}

\hypertarget{section-6.1-anticipated-expansion}{%
\subsubsection{Section 6.1 -- Anticipated
Expansion}\label{section-6.1-anticipated-expansion}}

The Members acknowledge that it is contemplated that the Company may
admit additional Members in the future, potentially including family
members of existing Members or other qualified individuals who may
contribute to the Company's business objectives.

\hypertarget{section-6.2-dilution-and-adjustment}{%
\subsubsection{Section 6.2 -- Dilution and
Adjustment}\label{section-6.2-dilution-and-adjustment}}

Upon the admission of any new Member, the Membership Interests of
existing Members shall be adjusted pro rata unless the Members
unanimously agree to a different allocation. All Members shall execute
an amendment to this Agreement reflecting any changes to Membership
Interests.

\hypertarget{section-6.3-right-of-first-refusal}{%
\subsubsection{Section 6.3 -- Right of First
Refusal}\label{section-6.3-right-of-first-refusal}}

Before any Member may transfer a Membership Interest to a third party,
the other Members shall have a right of first refusal to acquire such
interest on the same terms and conditions offered by the third party.

\begin{center}\rule{0.5\linewidth}{0.5pt}\end{center}

\hypertarget{article-vii-dissolution-and-winding-up}{%
\subsection{ARTICLE VII -- DISSOLUTION AND WINDING
UP}\label{article-vii-dissolution-and-winding-up}}

The Company shall be dissolved upon the occurrence of any of the
following events: (a) the unanimous written consent of all Members; (b)
the entry of a decree of judicial dissolution; or (c) any other event
causing dissolution under applicable law. Upon dissolution, the
Company's affairs shall be wound up in accordance with the Texas
Business Organizations Code.

\begin{center}\rule{0.5\linewidth}{0.5pt}\end{center}

\hypertarget{article-viii-miscellaneous}{%
\subsection{ARTICLE VIII --
MISCELLANEOUS}\label{article-viii-miscellaneous}}

\hypertarget{section-8.1-governing-law}{%
\subsubsection{Section 8.1 -- Governing
Law}\label{section-8.1-governing-law}}

This Agreement shall be governed by and construed in accordance with the
laws of the State of Texas, without regard to its conflict of laws
principles.

\hypertarget{section-8.2-amendments}{%
\subsubsection{Section 8.2 -- Amendments}\label{section-8.2-amendments}}

This Agreement may be amended only by a written instrument signed by all
Members.

\hypertarget{section-8.3-entire-agreement}{%
\subsubsection{Section 8.3 -- Entire
Agreement}\label{section-8.3-entire-agreement}}

This Agreement constitutes the entire agreement among the Members with
respect to the subject matter hereof and supersedes all prior agreements
and understandings.

\hypertarget{section-8.4-severability}{%
\subsubsection{Section 8.4 --
Severability}\label{section-8.4-severability}}

If any provision of this Agreement is held to be invalid or
unenforceable, the remaining provisions shall continue in full force and
effect.

\begin{center}\rule{0.5\linewidth}{0.5pt}\end{center}

\hypertarget{signatures}{%
\subsection{SIGNATURES}\label{signatures}}

\textbf{IN WITNESS WHEREOF}, the undersigned Members have executed this
Operating Agreement as of the Effective Date first written above.

\textbf{MEMBER:}

\begin{center}\rule{0.5\linewidth}{0.5pt}\end{center}

Michael Clement Matejka\\

Ian Bennett Matejka\\
Date: \_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_

\begin{center}\rule{0.5\linewidth}{0.5pt}\end{center}

\textbf{ACKNOWLEDGMENT OF OPTIONEE:}

The undersigned acknowledges receipt of this Operating Agreement and
agrees to be bound by the terms of Article III (Membership Option) upon
exercise thereof.

\begin{center}\rule{0.5\linewidth}{0.5pt}\end{center}

Wolfram Laube (Optionee)\\
Date: \_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_
